intro: Trichostema ovatum, commonly known as the bluecurls, is a flowering plant native to California and parts of Oregon. It is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Trichostema ovatum is often found in rocky soils and open habitats, thriving in full sun. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, known for its medicinal and ornamental uses.
